intro: Galium implexum, commonly known as bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. Its stems are often hairy and can be somewhat woody at the base. Galium implexum is known for its fragrant foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
